intro: Hebanthodes peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories or rocky soils. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
